intro: Rhynchospora testui, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brown flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense clusters at the base. Rhynchospora testui plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
